text: hello everyone welcome to another
episode of UK women essay industry Tech
talks in today's session I'm going to
talk about a use case related to one of
our Print Media customer where we
created an automated press article
generation using gen I'm radika jaula
I'm a big data prototyping architect at
AWS I'm part of prototyping and Cloud
engineering team also called as Pace at
PACE team we help customers build
prototypes for their innovative ideas we
prove to customers that their technical
aspirations Cloud transformation and
business goals can be achieved with AWS
as their technology partner as part of
my role I help customers build
prototypes along with them using AWS
analytic Services purpose-built
databases and Big Data
Frameworks what we'll cover today we
cover customer use case and challenge
goals and expectations our road map to
the solution ution how we solve the
problem finally some examples as outcome
and
recommendations one of our Swiss based
Print Media customer who has a global
presence is major player in media
industry they have been shaping the way
people consume Muse and entertainment
across the globe this customer is faced
with a challenge to provide content in
different formats that is suitable to
different audience for example a news
related to current affairs entertainment
or sports are of interest to General
audience whereas a news related to trads
or stocks are of interest to specific
audience and should include more details
on numbers and
graphs typically in the news industry
the news articles are provided by news
agencies which is then Rewritten
manually that includes proof reading and
adapting to company's wording this
process includes a lot of manual work
and is off slow to streamline this
process and support the journalistic
work the customer wanted to automate the
process of rewriting using jna they
reached out to prototyping team to
support this Innovative approach and
provide architectural guidance and
Technical knowledge on
jna the goal is to build an assistant
for editors that processes and generates
content in different styles the ultimate
goal is to accelerate the publication
process with less human effort
needed as you can see on the right the
editor should be able to choose one of
these styles with error correction
option the article should be Rewritten
with any of the spelling and grammar
Corrections with informal option the
article should be generated with
creative wordings with formal option the
article should be generated with formal
wordings with formal with context option
the article should be generated with
form wordings but additional information
taken from the previous latest relevant
articles there are many ways to
customize a foundation model typically
the life cycle starts with a simple
prompt engineering then Rag and then
fine-tuning and as a final step if none
of the approaches Pro to solve the
problem we go with pre-training a model
also as you see as we move towards the
right the cost of implementation and the
complexity increases whereas As you move
towards the top the accuracy increases
we have to find a sweet spot where we
can achieve results with good quality
performance and with considerable
costs here are the models we
experimented with during our prototype
some of these Foundation models like
llama Jurassic Claude are available on
bedrock and hence could interact with
them directly through bedrock endpoints
for others we use Sage maker to
customize the models to interact with
them so now let's take a look at the key
steps that we took and the decisions we
made at each stage we started with
simple prompt engineering on each of the
models most of the models were
disregarded due to limitations
particularly around German language
despite tuning the prompts some models
prove to have shown good results in
terms of spelling and grammar correction
but struggled to rewrite the Articles as
formal and informal Styles claw
demonstrated good results in spelling
grammar correction and also demonstrated
to create better articles in formal and
informal
style we then explored implementing drag
to store sample articles with customer
specific style and providing this along
with prompt this demonstrated good
results in some of the cases but not
others for example articles related to
specific recent events like election or
Sports when provided with context
improve the quality of Rewritten
articles whereas General news like
crimes accidents reduce the article
quantity so this approach should be used
carefully and only for Relevant
articles attempts at parameter efficient
fine-tuning using techniques like Cura
were effective for exploring different
approaches But ultimately resulted in
poor performance the El introduced
errors hallucinations as well as
grammatically poor
sentences finally RL HF is a process of
learning from Human feedback to optimize
the models to self-learn due to lack of
data in Prototype we were unable to
implement this technique however the
ability to rank the outputs have been
provided to enable the customer to
utilize this data for improvements now
let's look at the following slides on
how this can be implemented
this is a simple UI that has been
designed user can copy paste original
article to be Rewritten and will have
four options to choose from Once the
generate button is pressed the improved
article is generated on the right side
the user doesn't have to have any
knowledge on gen or llms all the
automation happens in under the hood as
you can see there is also an option for
the user to rate this article this
accumulated data will help in
implementing RL HF method as discussed
in previous slide in the following
slides we will go through the high level
architecture to see what are the various
steps and service involved in
accomplishing this
process the first step is to load the
Articles into S3 bucket on a periodic
basis once the file becomes available in
S3 bucket the article order Lambda is
triggered
this in turn invokes Bedrock to generate
embeddings insert the embeddings into
Vector database while retrieving the
database credentials from Secret manager
in this case we are using Aurora post
SQL as Vector database in this step the
articles are preprocessed to format the
original article this includes adding
four components to the article super
title main title lead and Main text the
processed articles are stored back into
S3
then the user can select one of the four
options to generate the
article when generate button is pressed
the article generator Lambda is
triggered with relevant parameters to
produce the improved
article the article generator Lambda
makes a call to llm to generate
embeddings for the original article and
upon receiving them fetches the closest
match from the Aurora database the
closest match is feted based on recency
and
proximity relevant articles are
retrieved from S3 based on the
context the Lambda then consolidates
user selected options the context and
the original article to form a prompt
this is then submitted to bedrock llm to
generate a new
article once the Lambda receives the
response the generated article window is
refreshed with an improved article you
users can then decide whether they are
satisfied with the result or wish to
explore different
modes now let's look at some of the
examples of how articles are Rewritten
for each selected options these examples
have been translated from German to
English for
readability as you can see on the left
is the original article and on the right
is the Rewritten article first thing to
notice is that the Rewritten article is
formatted into four sections as expected
including super title main title lead
and Main text this article is a generic
news about an accident that has
happened in this example the user has
selected an option to correct errors as
you can see on the right side The
Heading has been formatted as headline
and the text has been translated from
caps to camel case Additionally the text
guidance in the original article is
incomplete information and has been
translated to a meaningful title rest of
the article Remains the Same and only
the corrections have been
done in this example the user has
selected the informal option as you can
see on the right side the llm has used
creative phrases for super title like
shocking accident it also used catchy
phrases like driver flee terrible
accident driver overlooked the child it
also added a few dramatic phases like
the driver fled the seat from the
accident without any further attention
to the victim also the original article
does not indicate injuries to the child
and the Rewritten article portrays that
the child required medical care after
the accident it also added emotional
messages like the accident is shocking
and the driver's recklessness must have
consequences as you see this option
should be used carefully when the
editors want to publish any articles
with such creative writing
now let's see what happens when a formal
option is
selected as you can see the same article
has been Rewritten in a very formal
style the wordings like child was taken
to hospital with unknown injuries
indicate that no new additional
information is added and the overall
wording is very formal with no emotional
or dramatic
wordings finally this is the example
where an option of formal with context
is selected as explained earlier in this
example the article is Rewritten with
additional information taken from
previous latest relevant articles since
this is generic news about accident
there could be several other previous
articles related to accidents and the
llm has picked up wordings from them the
phrases like the boy was thrown several
meters through the air is clearly not in
the original article also it has
appended additional information about
poce looking for the driver hence this
option should be choosed very carefully
it is not appropriate in such generic
news articles but could be helpful in
articles like elections or traits where
details from previous latest articles
could be relevant to add additional
informations like statistics or
Trends in summary the majority of top
performing articles of breaking news are
publ published quickly with minimal
rewriting however there is no one
particular model or method that achieves
the same outcome for all types of
Articles here are some of the
recommendations based on the Prototype
tested all the outputs that were
generated were validated by a proof
reader although the editor assistant was
able to rewrite the Articles quickly and
efficiently we recommend to have a proof
reader in the loop to maintain control
the other recommendation is to implement
reinforcement learning from Human
feedback
rlf which uses human feedback to
optimize ml models to self-learn more
efficiently this involves generating
customer specific writing style using
ranking system output for different
style options for
articles this method may take some time
but potentially generate better custom
models with better and more consistent
Style
here are some of the resources that you
can refer to to learn more about bedrock
and implementing D
patterns we have now reached the end of

content and are ready to explore our
